data.text: @DrStephChambers @pmeierprof Good luck. Does not sound easy.

@DrStephChambers Sorry to hear that - so difficult. I imagine it’s even harder with a 3 year old. At least school have sent work for when he’s better. All fingers crossed that he’s all clear soon and most importantly that you’re not getting a positive just as everyone else is ok again!

@pmeierprof Sorry to hear that Petra. We're in same boat 🤦🏼‍♀️ every morning we explain to the 3 year old why he can't go to nursery or go anywhere else... Day 6 and still very strong positive, dad positive too. I'm ok so far... Dreading the next 4 days!

@pmeierprof You might be surprised - I had to cuddle son3 through night terrors with him coughing and sneezing all over me when he had covid in January and I tested negative everyday throughout. I did have covid myself before I had the jabs & booster though.
@NiamhCreate We decided to just all stay home for now as kiddo is feeling quite miserable with it and wants lots of cuddles, so don’t fancy our chances of not catching it.

@pmeierprof I guess I was thinking fine to nip out to the shops/pick up other kids if negative, but more of a dilemma if going to populous spaces...  I have mixed feelings - the less we all isolate the more vulnerable people will feel like they can't go anywhere.
@pmeierprof Sorry to hear that Petra.Get well soon!
@pmeierprof Oh no! Hope it’s quick and mild, sending all best wishes!

@NiamhCreate Just debating the ‘what’s the less wrong thing to do’ - other half is due to teach in her 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿 University job tomorrow, non-striking institution. Train travel, students etc if quite likely she’s picked it up by now. But in England no isolation mandate even if positive so 🤷‍♀️.
